results.title: Girl guides parade at Windsor Castle (19/6/1938)
results.brief_description: On June 19, 1938 a thousand Guides from all over the country marched past their majesties the King and Queen in the quadrangle of Windsor Castle. Her Majesty is patroness of the Association. Silent film - no credits or title available.

results.title: Giraffe
results.brief_description: Shows without commentary the simple daily patterns of the giraffe at home in Tanzania. Examines through close ups its unusual shape and size: its markings, height and long legs.

results.title: Gina Jeffreys: somebody's daughter the story so far
results.brief_description: This video offers an insight into the background, aspirations, influences, thoughts and dreams of country singer Gina Jeffreys. Born and raised in Toowoomba, Gina moved away from her family to settle in Sydney and further her musical career which began when she won the Star Maker award in 1991 (although she does have fond memories of busking at the local Mexican restaurant). Since then Gina has been awarded the Golden Guitar at Tamworth for Best Female Vocalist three years in a row. Gina relates memories of her rise to fame and footage is provided from the launch of her latest album, “Somebody’s daughter”. Full music clips are provided of “Dancin’ with Elvis”, “Josephine” and “I haven’t got a heart”.

results.title: Gifted kids
results.creator_credit: Keet Neville, Jennifer Torrance, John Taylor and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Exceptional or gifted children represent a great potential for society, yet the majority of these children go unrecognized because public educational systems are not geared to challenge their academic, artistic and personal growth. This documentary, through interviews with teachers, parents and gifted students in Coquitlam, British Columbia, looks at one of the few school districts in North America that has continually expanding enrichment programs throughout its primary and secondary grades. The film examines how these programs stimulate the students’ particular talents, and discusses some of the problems that gifted children face in the absence of such resources.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Keet Neville, Jennifer Torrance, John Taylor and ONF | NFB

results.title: Gifted kids
results.creator_credit: Kay Donovan and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description: Grace and Billy Tao are Australian parents of three extremely gifted sons. Terry (14) is a Maths whiz who began university studies at age 9. His younger brother, Trevor (12), was born autistic but as a young child revealed an exceptional talent as a musician. The youngest, Nigel (10) is an all rounder but his IQ is still far higher than the national average. The Tao boys are shown at home and school and discuss how being recognised as a “gifted child” affects their lives. Includes interviews with their parents and teachers.

results.title: Giant turtles
results.brief_description: Shows sea turtles coming ashore by night to lay their eggs before returning to the water. Also shows the hatching of the baby turtles two months later and their instinctive race for the water.

results.title: Giant devil dingo
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Dick Roughsey’s story of Gaiya, a dingo which once roamed the Australian bush killing people for food, is told to the accompaniment of didgeridoos.
